misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the computer implicitly understands the context of the problem (that a grade is restricted to the 0-100 range) and will automatically apply these constraints without explicit code, even when the logic provided covers values outside that range.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The Java execution model is context-blind; it only enforces the literal logic provided in the code. Without explicit validation or boundary checks, the program will process any integer input (e.g., 110 or -5) and assign it a letter grade based purely on the defined relational operations.
